subject: JUnit4: assertEquals(int, int) gives different exception from assertEquals(String,String)

While developing the parameterised test extension for JUnit4, I've
currentl=
y got two tests in a broken state (yes, I know).

Both are using Assert.ass=
ertEquals - but one (the pair of ints) ends up
failing with a java.lang.Ass=
ertionError, whereas the pair of strings
ends up failing with a junit.frame=
work.ComparisonFailure.

Obviously, both are test failures, and both have r=
easonable messages -
but is there any reason for the inconsistency here?

J=
on Skeet
